page.title: 12Vegetation of Two Bridges
page.content:
This area is typical moorland with lots of different plants including Purple Moor Grass, Fescue, Bog Moss, Bell Heather and individual Rowan (Mountain Ash) trees.
The grasses are the more dominant plant. Bog Moss is usually found in the marshy areas. There is also some Gorse growing as well as Tormentil and Creeping Bedstraw.
In some places there are coniferous forests which have been planted by the Forestry Commission and other private bodies for timber, as, for example, at Beardown Hill Plantation.
Around the valleys and farms there are some deciduous trees like Beech, Hawthorn, Alder and Blackthorn.
